definitions.definition: A contrapuntal piece of music wherein a particular melody is played in a number of voices , each voice introduced in turn by playing the melody.
Anything in literature, poetry, film, painting, etc., that resembles a fugue in structure or in its elaborate complexity and formality.

main_definition: ( music ) A contrapuntal piece of music wherein a particular melody is played in a number of voices , each voice introduced in turn by playing the melody.
secondary_definitions: Anything in literature, poetry, film, painting, etc., that resembles a fugue in structure or in its elaborate complexity and formality.
